title: Ford Otosan OpenXC Hackathon - 3rd Place
description: There were 26 teams. We built a real-time data analysis application for cars, that detects potential car crashes and sends emergency texts, shows the cheapest nearby gas stations with their gas efficiencies, shows the speed limits of your road and so on.

title: Invent & COMPEC Data Analytics Hackathon - 3rd Place
description: There were 20 teams. I built, tested and deployed 3 ML models - neural network, multinomial logistic regression and multivariate linear regression - using TensorFlow to forecast sales quantities of a company using its 2 years of data.

title: TechSummit IBM Hackathon 2017 - 1st Place
description: There were 11 teams. We built a smart bracelet for preventing harassment and I was responsible for the backend (Node.js), machine learning (TensorFlow), and whole web application (Pug & Bootstrap).

title: Comodo Hackathon - 1st Place
description: There were 16 teams. We built Wower, and I was responsible for the development of the desktop app (Electron, Node.js, AngularJS) and its RESTful API (Ruby on Rails).

title: UNFPA Innovation Day Project - 2nd Place
description: We made a project called "Goodwill Ambassadors" that used micro-influencers to help spread the ideas of United Nations Population Fund.

title: Büyük Sıçrama IOT Hackathon - 1st Place
description: There were more than 20 teams. We built WowDoor and I was responsible for the backend API (serverless architecture with Microsoft Azure).

title: TechSummit Hackathon 2016 - 2nd Place
description: There were nearly 10 teams. I've built a mail classifier that uses Naive Bayes algorithm.

title: COMPEC Garaj Hackathon - 1st Place
description: There were nearly 10 teams. We built a simple game to give people some knowledge about online information security.
